description: NTS Map 082J11Hydroline was a long, open, gradual uphill for about 4 kms. Elk Pass was scenic and mostly downhill or flat. Fox Creek and Boulton Creek was a narrow trail surrounded by a thick forest - very beautiful.This trail is at:Click Here  for a map of PLP.Click Here  for snow and trail grooming conditions.Visit the Peter Lougheed Park Visitors Center. Great displays, a  relaxing room with a fireplace, and a parks person to help you with your questions.
directions: Go 49.7km S of TransCanada #1 on Hiway 40 and turn west into the PLP. Between ~Dec 15 and June 15 hiway 40 is closed at the turn so it is very easy to find.For this section of trails, once you turn off #40, drive 2.2 km and keep to the left. Drive 9.6 to the left until you reach the  Elk Pass Ski Parking lot.
title: Peter Lougheed Park - Hydroline, Elk P,Boulton Crk
